      This method adds a piece to the board during the game to the location of the tile.
      boolean checkSave()
      Checks if a saved file exists, and if there is no directory associated with it.
      void clearBoard()
      Looks at all the checker pieces and sets each button to have no icon
      void customGame()
      When the custom game option is selected, (when prompted by the Custom Game button) this function takes the custom setup that was previously received from user input and stored as an array (tiles), and sets the respective buttons to be enabled.

      This method highlights the selected piece.

      Opens a saved file and reads each line, parses it into a checker array, where each line is a new checker.

      This implements minMax Algorithm This algorithm is explained in Documentation
      void placeChecker(java.lang.String location)
      When user chooses custom setup and selects the number of black and grey pieces to put on the board, this function allows it to place each checker on the board.
      void removepiece(java.lang.String location)
      This method removes a checker piece from the board.
      void saveGame()
      This function writes the enabled pieces that are currently on the board into a text file which is then saved and can be loaded at a later time.
      void setGame()
      When the Standard Game option is selected, this function sets the pieces on the board as per the requirements of a standard checkers game.
      void standardGame()
      when the standard game option is selected (when prompted by New Game) sets up a standard 12 piece versus 12 piece checkers game

      This method unhighlights the selected piece.

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • XCoord

        private java.lang.String[] XCoord
        These arrays are the grid that compose the board. The XCoord Array holds the letters A-H that span the possible movement spaces from left to right of the game window.

      • inPath

        private java.lang.Boolean inPath

      • YCoord

        private java.lang.Integer[] YCoord
        The YCoord Array holds the numbers 1-8 that span the possible movement spaces from top to bottom of the game window

      • coordinates

        private java.lang.String[][] coordinates
        Contains Coordinates for every tile and is used to set it up in a grid layout to resemble a checkers game board

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainGUI

        public MainGUI()
        Creates the main window and the checker board (composed of buttons) for the game

    • Method Detail

      • standardGame

        public void standardGame()
        when the standard game option is selected (when prompted by New Game) sets up a standard 12 piece versus 12 piece checkers game

      • customGame

        public void customGame()
        When the custom game option is selected, (when prompted by the Custom Game button) this function takes the custom setup that was previously received from user input and stored as an array (tiles), and sets the respective buttons to be enabled.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This function writes the enabled pieces that are currently on the board into a text file which is then saved and can be loaded at a later time.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • checkSave

        public boolean checkSave()
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Checks if a saved file exists, and if there is no directory associated with it.
        Returns:
        boolean True if file exists else false
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • clearBoard

        public void clearBoard()
        Looks at all the checker pieces and sets each button to have no icon

      • placeChecker

        public void placeChecker(java.lang.String location)
        When user chooses custom setup and selects the number of black and grey pieces to put on the board, this function allows it to place each checker on the board. First the user pushes the black pieces onto the board by clicking the appropriate button. Each valid click reduces the maxBlack counter by 1. Once all the black pieces are placed (maxBlack counter is 0), the grey pieces follow the same process until the remaining pieces from the counter (total) is 0.
        Parameters:
        location -

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame()
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Opens a saved file and reads each line, parses it into a checker array, where each line is a new checker. Then places these checkers onto the board.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • setGame

        public void setGame()
        When the Standard Game option is selected, this function sets the pieces on the board as per the requirements of a standard checkers game.

      • removepiece

        public void removepiece(java.lang.String location)
        This method removes a checker piece from the board. The method searches for the coordinate of the selected checker piece that the user want to move using a for loop and sets the icon of that piece to null.
        Parameters:
        location - the location where the checker piece is being moved to

      • addpiece

        public void addpiece(java.lang.String location)
        This method adds a piece to the board during the game to the location of the tile. It uses for loops to see if the piece is a black or white piece. Then for each of the black and white checks, another for loop checks if the piece is a king or not. Then a Checker piece is added depending on which for loop was executed.
        Parameters:
        location - the location where the checker piece is being moved to

      • highlightTile

        public void highlightTile(java.lang.String Location)
        This method highlights the selected piece. It uses a for loop to find the coordinates of the piece, then sets the color of the coodinate's border to yellow.
        Parameters:
        Location - the location where the checker piece is being moved to

      • unhighlightTile

        public void unhighlightTile(java.lang.String Location)
        This method unhighlights the selected piece. It uses a for loop to find the coordinates of the piece, then sets the color of the coodinate's border to white.
        Parameters:
        Location - the location where the checker piece is being moved to

      • minMax

        public boolean minMax(Checker[] Checkers)
        This implements minMax Algorithm This algorithm is explained in Documentation
        Parameters:
        Checkers -
        Returns:
        True when complete

      • maxIndex

        public static int maxIndex(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> list)

      • gameHandler

        public void gameHandler(java.lang.String command)

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Receives the actions associated with each button and saves it as a string. When the user clicks the button, the program performs the action associated with it.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
